Integration Views

Lesson
objectives

¢ Define the purpose of Integration Views

Configure an Integration View schema,
mapping, and filter

Generate JSON output

Generate XML output

| Why use an Integration View?

¢ Produce external views of the
Guidewire domain model

* Schemas and mappings are explicitly
named and versioned

+ Different versions of the same schema
and/or mappings can co-exist

¢ Output format is explicitly designed in
the schema

¢ Simple design approach

¢ Define the output schema first and then
map the data to that output

Gi

Ss s
es

External
View

m Andy",
“primaryAddress™ : {
TaddressType” : “home”
}
)

| Integration View components Gi

¢ An Integration View has the following

components: _ Ni configuration » 1% config ) [5 integration
* Schemas

+ AJSON Schema defines the structure of the data Eu filterstmta
* Can be targeted by multiple mappings & address_minimel-1.0.9ql

* Mappings @ contactnote_details-1.0.gql
—>v mappings.tmn.ta
+ Describes how to transform a given source object such as an entity if) address-1.0.mapping,json
into a JSON or XML document that conforms to that schema & contact-1.0.mapping,json
. ‘§ contactnote-1.0.mapping,json
+ Targets a single JSON Schema == vB schemas

+ Filters ie

domain fields to export

3. Define the filters

export a subset of contact
data

+ Gender
* Primary address and its fields ts seieste
* Contact notes and its fields

« Export a subset of data

| Create a JSON Schema Gi

* Create a new package under integration.schemas

+ config.integration.schemas.<company_code>.<product_code>

* Create a new file with the following syntax:

7 A 7 > pl fi k

« <mechanism>- {version} .schema. json oe Famewor

 address-1.0.schema,json

{

"$schema": "http: //json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
"definitions": {}

}

| Supported data types

« JSON natively defines a small set of primitive types: string, boolean, numbers

(which are interpreted as doubles), object, and array

« JSON Schema (and Swagger) define an integer type, which is a number with a decimal

component of .0

« JSON Schema (and Swagger) has a format property to describe more complex
data types: dates, numeric types that require a higher level of precision, binary

data, and so forth

*« Custom x-gw-type property is added to map Guidewire internal types in cases
where a format would be ambiguous, such as: typekeys, MonetaryAmount and

CurrencyAmount

Type

Format

x-gw-type Standard

string
string

string

gw-money
gw-money

<none>

gw.pl.currency.MonetaryAmount Guidewire
gw.api.financials.currencyAmount Guidewire

<any typekey>.* type Guidewire

Gi

| Add schema definitions

* Each definition must
define its name, type,
and properties

* By default, JSON
Schema properties are
not nullable

* On output, null properties
on JsonObject are omitted

Gi

"$schema" : "http: //json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#",
"x-gw-import" : {

"address" : "trn.ta.address-1.0",
"contactnote" : "trn.ta.contactnote-1.0"
le
"definitions" : {

"ContactDetails" : {
"type" : "object",
"properties" : {
"Name" : {
"type" : "string"
lh
"DateOfBirth" : {
"type" : "string",
"format' "date-time"
"Gender" : {
"type" : "string",
"x-gw-type" : "typekey.GenderType"
}

| Schema file import Gi

* Schema import provides a mechanism for reuse of schemas, by creating a shared
schema for common pieces and then importing that schema in order to reference
its types

¢ If Aimports B, definitions in A and B that have the same name are still two different types

1 {

he

schema definition

for that property

+ Filters make use of a simplified version : ! =
of GraphQL syntax to describe the sch » pong « Pama

should be included for a given invocation of
a mapping file

¢ Allows reuse of a more complete
f a

only require a subset of that data aS

| Create a filter Gi

* Create a new package under integration.filters
* config.integration.filters.<company_code>.<product_code>

* Create a new file with the following syntax:
address_minimal-1.0.gql

contact_details-1.0.gql

contactnote_details-1.0.gql

« <mechanism>-{version}.gql

data you want to fetch 8 }

* For example, a Contact may have both AddressType
PrimaryAddress and AllAddresses cael
properties that map to the same Address }
type

+ Define the set of properties you want from an
Address once, as a fragment

+ Reference that fragment in each context that
you want that same set of properties

| Generate wrapper classes

1. Add the fully-qualified name of the
schema(s) in the codegen-

schemas.txt file in schemas package

2. From the Server drop-down in Studio,
select JsonSchemaCodegen

* Execute by selecting Run ‘Server’ icon

3. Generated wrapper classes will be
under

configuration.srce.jsonschema

| Schema file combination

* Schema combination provides a

mechanism for reuse of schemas

* Ability to create a schema that logically
extends and overrides one or more other

schemas

* If Acombines [B, C] listed in that order in

the combine property
+ Contents of B are merged on top of C

+ Contents of A are merged on top of the
combined schema

+ Similar names are merged together to produce a single definition

* Combination cannot remove definitions

* Original schemas are not touched

YBa integration
apis

fitertmnte
mappings ay |

eve

> Bademo.ta
> Bl gw.plframework
v Da sita

contact-1,0.schemajzon

"trn.ta.contact-1.0"
I,

"type" : "object",
"properties" : {
"AssignedUser" : {
"$ref" : "#/definitions/AssignedUser"
}
}
h

"type" : "object",
"properties" : {
"DisplayName" : {
"type" : "string"

| Mapper file combination

* Mapper combination provides a
mechanism for reuse of mappers

* Combination rules used for schemas apply

to mappers

}
}

"path" : "User.DisplayName"

| Schema file combination

* Schema combination provides a

mechanism for reuse of schemas

* Ability to create a schema that logically
extends and overrides one or more other

schemas

* If Acombines [B, C] listed in that order in

the combine property
+ Contents of B are merged on top of C

+ Contents of A are merged on top of the
combined schema

+ Similar names are merged together to produce a single definition

* Combination cannot remove definitions

* Original schemas are not touched

| Mapper file combination

* Mapper combination provides a
mechanism for reuse of mappers

* Combination rules used for schemas apply

to mappers
